diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Familial Multiplicity of Estrogen Insensitivity associated with a Loss-of-Function ESR1 Mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of estrogen insensitivity syndrome was strongly suggested by the clinical presentation of primary amenorrhea, delayed bone maturation, extremely high plasma 17Î²-estradiol levels, and elevated gonadotrophin levels. Genetic analysis revealed a homozygous mutation of the ESR1 gene, leading to a significant impairment of ER function, confirming the diagnosis.
